p: The use of a promiscuous, yet tuneable, reaction toolkit allows multiple diverse, yet synthetically accessible, chemotypes to be explored in parallel. This contrasts with overwhelming medicinal chemistry practice in which perceived synthetic accessibility tends to influence which molecules are prioritised for synthesis. In several cases, retrospective analysis showed that other chemotypes had been explored in ADS reaction arrays: for example, intramolecular insertion into an aryl Câˆ’H bond in substrates similar to A3 gave oxindoles rather than lactams as products. 9 These alternative chemotypes were not taken forward because other reactions had resulted in more active product mixtures.
